resource.name: Memphis Police Department: Public Safety Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset contains all crime incidents where a police report was taken. Data goes back to 2006 and is updated on a daily basis.

Terms of Use: The information in this portal is provided strictly as a courtesy to the public. This website provides information as to initial crime reports, and does not reflect subsequent changes in the investigation, nature, or accuracy of the initial report. While all attempts are made to ensure the correctness and suitability of information presented here, neither the City of Memphis nor the Memphis Police Department guarantee the accuracy of the information contained herein. Crime data may be amended or corrected by the Memphis Police Department at any time. This data may not reflect the official crime index totals as reported to the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation.
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council Super District Boundaries Dec 2022' (scpn-qt9a) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council District Boundaries Dec 2022' (fuzm-ngj2) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

resource.name: FY18 MWBE Gender & Ethnicity Report
resource.description: This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY18 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises (MWBEs) by gender and ethnicity. Please note that SAIC subcontractor spend was reported by a third party entity and is not available by ethnicity and gender.

resource.name: FY22 MWBE Citywide Spend by Gender/Ethnicity Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY21 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises (MWBEs) by gender and ethnicity.

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.

resource.name: Aggregated Service Requests
resource.description: This dataset shows the number of service requests completed each month by type, and the average number of days it took to complete them. These service requests are aggregated from multiple sources, including 311 service requests, SeeClickFix, and requests created by city users. Where applicable, the service level agreement (SLA) is also shown, as well as the number of service requests completed within the SLA, within two times the SLA, and more than two times the SLA.
columns_description: Month and year in which the service requests were closed
Number of service requests completed each month by type
Number of requests closed within two times the SLA
Percent of requests closed within the SLA
Number of requests closed more than two times the SLA
Number of requests closed within the SLA
Goal (in number of days) for the City to close a specific request type. SLA stands for "Service Level Agreement."
Type of service request
Average number of days to close all requests for a specific request type
Database tool that assigns a number to each month and allows sorting by month order

resource.name: Census Tracts
resource.description: Census Tracts are determined by the U.S. Census Bureau for calculating the decennial census. Census tracts are a subdivision of the County level and vary in size. Ideally a census tract contains a population of 4,000 people and 1,600 housing units. 209 census tracts intersect or fall within the City of Memphis boundary.

resource.name: FY22 Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) Spend Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY22 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises. The breakdown includes data for all divisions in addition to a citywide total.

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.
columns_name: Percent Certified + Non Certified MWBE Spend
columns_description: Total dollars spent with an MWBE firm (MBE Spend + WBE Spend)
Total MWBE Spend + Non-Certified MWBE Spend
Total dollar spent with MWBE Firms, direct spend + subcontractor spend
Total amount of dollars excluded from MWBE calculations in FY, due to nature of spend
Total Spend minus Total Exclusions, denominator of MWBE formula
Total amount of dollars spent in FY
Total dollars spent with a woman owned firm subcontractor, as reported by prime contractors and audited by OBDC
Total dollars spent with a woman owned firm
Certified + Non Certified Spend divided by Total Eligible Spend
Total MWBE Spend divided by Total Eligible Spend
Total dollars spent with non-certified firms
Total dollars spent with a MWBE subcontractor, as reported by prime contractors and audited by OBDC (MBE Subcontractor + WBE Subcontractor)
Total dollars spent with a minority owned firm
Total dollars spent with a minority owned  subcontractor, as reported by prime contractors and audited by OBDC

resource.name: FY20 MWBE Gender & Ethnicity Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY20 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises (MWBEs) by gender and ethnicity. 

*Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.
**Public Works spent an additional $19,956,641.03 with MWBE firms through the Sewer Assessment and Rehabilitation Program, which is managed by Black and Veatch. This amount is not included in the official report because it is managed by an outside entity. However, if that amount were included, Public Works percent MWBE spend would be 24.5%.
***Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.
****In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.

resource.name: Walkability Index
resource.description: The Walkability Index dataset characterizes every Census 2010 block group in the U.S. based on its relative walkability. Walkability depends upon characteristics of the built environment that influence the likelihood of walking being used as a mode of travel. The Walkability Index is based on the EPA's previous data product, the Smart Location Database (SLD). Walkabilty has been linked to increased physical activity and stronger social ties within the communities, promoting better health outcomes than less walkable areas.
columns_description: Geometry of census tracts used to map them in GIS
The street intersection density  is ranked (1 to 20) by block group. The higher the score the more dense the intersections are which increases the overall walkabilty of a census tract.

The walkabilty Index is ranked (1 to 20) by census tract. The higher the score the more walkable the census tract is. The scores are categorized into 4 groups: 1-5.75 (least walkable), 5.76- 10.50 (Below Average Walkabale), 10.51- 15.25  (Above Average Walkable), 15.26-20 (Most Walkable)
Census tract ID

resource.name: Community Neighborhoods Boundaries 1
resource.description:
This shapefile includes neighborhoods boundaries from Community Foundation, Innovate Memphis, neighborhood CDCs, and other civic groups for use on the map tools "Public Safety" and "Open311." It is not an exhaustive list. If you'd like add your group's boundaries, please contact Sarah Harris at sarah.harris@memphistn.gov.

Due to a limitation of the platform, community boundaries are split in to two groups to avoid overlapping boundaries.

resource.name: MPD Police Stations: Uniform Patrol Division
resource.description: The data set describes the 9 Police Stations operated under the Uniform Patrol Division of the Memphis Police Department (MPD). The Uniform Patrol Division is the largest division within the MPD and is responsible for responding to calls that occur within the City's 9 precincts. All 9 stations contain a  General Investigations Bureau, responsible for the investigation of the following criminal offenses: Accidental Injury, Aggravated Assault, Simple Assault, Animal Injury, Bribery, Burglary, Escapee, Intimidation, Motor Vehicle Theft, Pocket Picking, Robbery, Shoplifting, Suspicious Person, Theft, Threatening Phone Call, Obscene/Harassing Phone Call, Vandalism, Stolen Property, False Reporting, and Fire Alarms.
columns_description: The Police Stations are named according to the name of the street that is contained within the station's address
Precincts are MPD defined areas of coverage. Each Precinct area coresponds to a Police Station Location and is classified using the station's name (based on the station's street name)
The 9 stations/ precincts of MPD's Uniform Patrol Division are organized into District 1 or District 2
The 6 sub-divisions of each precinct the coresponding station is responsible for

resource.name: FY23 Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) Spend Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY23 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises. The breakdown includes data for all divisions in addition to a citywide total.

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.
columns_name: Percent Certified + Non Certified MWBE Spend
columns_description: Total Spend minus Total Exclusions, denominator of MWBE formula
Total dollars spent with a minority owned firm
Total dollars spent with a woman owned firm
Total dollars spent with an MWBE firm (MBE Spend + WBE Spend)
Total dollars spent with a minority owned subcontractor, as reported by prime contractors and audited by OBDC
Total dollars spent with a MWBE subcontractor, as reported by prime contractors and audited by OBDC (MBE Subcontractor + WBE Subcontractor)
Total amount of dollars spent in FY
Total MWBE Spend divided by Total Eligible Spend
Total dollars spent with non-certified firms
Total MWBE Spend + Non-Certified MWBE Spend
Certified + Non Certified Spend divided by Total Eligible Spend
Total dollars spent with a woman owned firm subcontractor, as reported by prime contractors and audited by OBDC
Total dollar spent with MWBE Firms, direct spend + subcontractor spend
Total amount of dollars excluded from MWBE calculations in FY, due to nature of spend

resource.name: Economic Development
resource.description: This dataset shows the PILOTs, Loans, Grants, & Bonds that have been issued by the Economic Development Growth Engine (EDGE) and the Downtown Memphis Commission (DMC) since 2010. PILOTs are property tax freezes for a certain length of time and used to incentivize economic development and capital investment.
resource.attribution: Economic Development Growth Engine and Downtown Memphis Commission
columns_description: Total projected capital investment, in dollars
Dollar amount of storefront improvement grant received, if applicable
Dollar amount of development loan received, if applicable
Dollar amount of EDGE loan or grant received, if applicable
Type of incentive- PILOT (payment in lieu of taxes), loan, grant, or bond
Name of company that received the PILOT, loan, grant or bond
Date the PILOT, Loan, Grant, or Bond was approved
Economic Development Growth Engine (EDGE) or Downtown Memphis Commission (DMC). Learn more about EDGE at http://www.growth-engine.org/ and about DMC at https://www.downtownmemphiscommission.com/.
Proposed development street address
Proposed development/business zip code
Proposed development state
Proposed development city

resource.name: 911 Performance
resource.description: This dataset shows the amount of time it takes the City of Memphis to answer calls to 911.
columns_description: Total number of calls received during the reporting month
National Emergency Number Association (NENA) standard target 911 call answer time, in seconds
City of Memphis target 911 call answer time, in seconds
The goal is to answer 95% of all calls within 20 seconds
Sum of Setup Time, Queue, and Ring
Monthly average number of seconds a caller spent in the queue
Monthly average number of seconds the phone rang before being answered
Percent of 911 calls in which the call was ended before a dispatcher answered
Monthly average number of seconds between when a call first seizes at the Public Safety Answering Point (PSAP) to when it begins ringing
Percent of 911 calls answered within 20 seconds

domain_metadata.value: Data is updated from ECats, an application which monitors performance statistics from 911 call system. A daily email is sent, including one with monthly stats.

resource.name: FY23 MWBE Citywide Spend by Gender/Ethnicity Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY21 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises (MWBEs) by gender and ethnicity.

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.

resource.name: FY20 Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) Spend Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY20 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises. The breakdown includes data for all divisions in addition to a citywide total.

*Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.

**Public Works spent an additional $19,956,641.03 with MWBE firms through the Sewer Assessment and Rehabilitation Program, which is managed by Black and Veatch. This amount is not included in the official report because it is managed by an outside entity. However, if that amount were included, Public Works percent MWBE spend would be 24.5%.

***Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.

****In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.
columns_name: Percent Certified + Non Certified MWBE Spend

resource.name: FY21 Minority & Women Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) Spend Report
resource.description:
This dataset shows the breakdown of City of Memphis FY21 spend with minority and women owned business enterprises. The breakdown includes data for all divisions in addition to a citywide total..

Footnotes
1. Unallocated represents those checks that were not attributed to a division at the time of payment.																									
2. Retirement investment, money manager, and custodian fees are excluded from eligible spend in this report, but will be included in a separate report produced by the Finance Division and Investment Manager.														
3. In the event that a business is eligible for both MBE and WBE certifications, the MBE certification is counted. However, a business may elect to maintain only a WBE certification. As a result, the Caucasian Female dollar percent will not exactly match the WBE percent.														
4. Payments to subcontractors are reported by prime contractors on a monthly basis, the total of which is reflected in Column J above. In some cases, depending on the date of prime payment and the date of reported sub payment, these payments could be split across reporting periods. In rare cases, this could result in a percentage over 100% due to the denominator being captured in one report, and the numerator being captured in the following report.
columns_name: Percent Certified + Non Certified MWBE Spend

MATAPlus is a shared ride paratransit service designed to meet the transportation needs of persons with disabilities in the Memphis area. resource.name: Community Neighborhoods Boundaries 2
resource.description:
This shapefile includes neighborhoods boundaries from Community Foundation, Innovate Memphis, neighborhood CDCs, and other civic groups for use on the map tools "Public Safety" and "Open311." It is not an exhaustive list. If you'd like add your group's boundaries, please contact Sarah Harris at sarah.harris@memphistn.gov.

Due to a limitation of the platform, community boundaries are split in to two groups to avoid overlapping boundaries.

resource.name: Residential & Commercial Alarms
resource.description:
This dataset shows detailed information related to the operation of the City's Metro Alarm Office, including the number of permits issued and the number of false alarms recorded each month.

Please note: From July 2017-present, the columns "False Alarms" and False Alarms Historical" are identical. Prior to the ordnance passed in June 2017, the only false alarms that could be counted were those verified and matched by MPD's reporting database. This is reflected in the "False Alarms" column, pre July 2017. In order to get a true reflection of the volume of historical false alarms, dispatched records were matched and aggregated. This is reflected in the column "False Alarms Historical," pre July 2017.
columns_description: Month order (1=January, 12=December)
Reporting month & year (date rounds to 1st of the month)
Commercial alarm permits added during the reporting month
Please see dataset description for further explanation.
Number of accounts that were charged for their 3rd false alarm.
Dollar amount collected during reporting month
Total false alarms received during the reporting month
Residential alarm permits added during the reporting month
Total dollar amount charged
Reporting month
Reporting year
Dollar amount billed during reporting month

resource.name: Memphis Police Department: Public Safety Incidents
resource.description:
This dataset contains all crime incidents where a police report was taken. Data goes back to 2006 and is updated on a daily basis.

Terms of Use: The information in this portal is provided strictly as a courtesy to the public. This website provides information as to initial crime reports, and does not reflect subsequent changes in the investigation, nature, or accuracy of the initial report. While all attempts are made to ensure the correctness and suitability of information presented here, neither the City of Memphis nor the Memphis Police Department guarantee the accuracy of the information contained herein. Crime data may be amended or corrected by the Memphis Police Department at any time. This data may not reflect the official crime index totals as reported to the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation.
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council Super District Boundaries Dec 2022' (scpn-qt9a) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council District Boundaries Dec 2022' (fuzm-ngj2) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

resource.name: MDR Scorecard Open Requests
resource.description: This dataset focuses on five high volume service requests: missed pickups, potholes, cart repair, weeds, and outside bin pickup.  It shows the current number of open requests and the length of time they have been open.
columns_description: Type of request. This dataset shows 5 selected high-volume request types: missed pickups, potholes, cart repair, weeds, and outside bin waste.
Number of requests that have been open for 16-30 days
Number of requests that have been open for 31-45 days
Number of requests that have been open for more than 45 days
Number of requests that have been open for 0-15 days
Number of open requests for each request type (updated daily)
